title: The iPhone Ultra’s rumored camera upgrade could make the iPhone 15 feel flat
description: New rumor states the iPhone Ultra could record spatial photos and videos for immersive experiences, but we're skeptical.

title: Okta warns scammers are going after super admin privileges
description: Hackers are trying to reset MFA tools for Okta accounts belonging to administrators.

title: Obscure startup plans 10,000TB data cartridges with popular material used in restrooms
description: Ceramic may displace holographic, DNA and silica as the next big thing in exotic storage

title: Windows users warned this important security tool is being removed soon
description: Windows deprecation of TSL 1.0 and 1.1 was put on hold due to the pandemic.

title: Don't buy an Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K – two new models are likely coming soon
description: The Amazon Fire TV Stick range could get two new additions soon, with regulatory filings pointing to updated 4K models.

title: Starfield flashlight mod projects Todd Howard's face so you're never alone in space
description: Someone has created a Starfield flashlight mod that projects the face of game director Todd Howard.

title: Microsoft pulls the plug on WordPad – these are the alternative text editors we recommend
description: Microsoft is pulling WordPad in the name of progress. Users can turn to alternatives like Word, Notepad, Google Docs, LibreOffice, or WPS Office.

title: This Chrome extension can steal your passwords - and Google has no problem with it
description: Researchers have found that popular websites store user passwords in plain text, and Chrome extensions have the means to steal them.

title: Crysis 3 online multiplayer will be shut down for good this week
description: Crysis 3's online servers will be closed on Thursday, September 7.

title: The newest 14-inch MEGABOOK T1 from Tecno is perfect for your back to school needs
description: The new 14-inch MEGABOOK T1 from Tecno is a small and powerful little workhorse that is lightweight enough to carry around on campus or in your backpack at school and also strong enough to get serious work done with ease.

title: Starfield will let you fly between planets but it could take hours
description: Starfield allows players to fly to any planet they want, only it'll take hours upon hours, and you can't actually manually land on them.

title: Microsoft SQL servers hijacked to deliver Cobalt Strike and ransomware
description: Hackers are getting creative with Microsoft SQL servers, researchers say, having detected novel distribution techniques.

title: Vampire: The Masquerade - Justice is releasing in November
description: Vampire: The Masquerade - Justice is set to release on Meta Quest 2, 3 and PSVR2 on November 2.

title: Call the security – Google’s Nest cameras just got a massive subscription price hike
description: Google's Nest Aware and Nest Aware Plus subscriptions just got a big price hike in the US, with other regions likely to follow.

title: Diablo 4 has a PvP bug that makes players immortal
description: Diablo 4 players are reporting a "critical" PvP bug that is making opponents unkillable.

title: Super Mario Bros. Wonder’s talking flowers can be muted, but you can’t stop their hints
description: Players will be able to switch off either the text or voice dialogue for the talking flowers, but not both.

title: A reason to skip the iPhone 15? The iPhone 16 could get a much brighter OLED screen
description: Apple could ape Samsung in adopting MLA tech for its iPhone 16 OLED displays.

title: The Apple Vision Pro could already have a potential competitor - A cheaper headset from Meta
description: If the Apple Vision Pro is too expensive for you, don’t worry - Meta could offer you a much cheaper headset.

title: Samsung’s LG-made OLED TVs are coming to Europe with a less confusing name… sort of
description: Samsung aims to make its lineup of WOLED TVs less confusing, but doesn’t quite succeed in its goal.

title: CNN news might interrupt you streaming Max in the future but not any time soon
description: Warner Bros. Discovery is reportedly thinking about a new feature for Max that you'll absolutely hate.

title: AI could help companies connect with customers like never before
description: Customers expect the best experience thanks to artificial intelligence, but they also want to know when AI is being used.

title: TCL’s new mini-LED TVs have Dolby Vision at 120Hz and more features could be coming
description: The next generation of MediaTek's Pentonic chips promise some seriously good gaming features for TVs.

title: Calloway data breach sees over a million golf fans afffected
description: Sensitive Calloway customer data has been stolen, including passwords and answers to secret questions.

title: Welcome to TechRadar’s Home Theater Week 2023
description: With the biggest custom home theater installers gathering this week, we've put together a series of articles to celebrate the occasion.

title: Many businesses still aren't using BYOD protection
description: Companies don’t have clear enough BYOD policies and are relying on a small handful of device management providers.

title: Bethesda game bugs are somewhat "intentional" as it lends to player freedom, says Pete Hines
description: Pete Hines has said that game bugs are inevitable and they ultimately allow the studio to lean into player freedom.

title: Leaked DJI Pocket 3 spotted out in the wild, sporting a much larger screen
description: Leaked pictures of what appears to be a DJI Pocket 3 reveal the gimbal-stabilized camera sports a much larger screen. What else can we hope for?

title: The next iPad Pros could be more MacBook-like than ever
description: The next iPad Pro could have a bigger screen, more storage, and a MacBook-like Magic Keyboard.

title: Paw Patrol snacks withdrawn after hackers hijack QR code to show porn
description: QR codes on Paw Patrol snacks sold by Lidl are redirecting customers to a dodgy website.

title: Good bass from open-ear earbuds? JBL’s Soundgear Sense might just have nailed it
description: JBL unveiled several products at IFA recently, but it's the unassuming Soundgear Sense that should be on your radar.

title: Redfall will eventually “be a good game”, Pete Hines says
description: Bethesda's head of publishing says Redfall won't be abandoned, and "we're going to keep working on it".

title: X confirms it will use public data to train AI models
description: X reveals it will be using your posts to train its AI models.

title: Baldur's Gate 3 companions were so forward at launch due to a bug, dev says
description: Baldur's Gate 3's game director has confirmed the reason for companions being so forward with the player at launch.

title: Facebook and Instagram may go ad-free... if you pay for a subscription
description: In a bid to avoid EU scorn, Meta could introduce paid Facebook and Instagram experience to provide an ad-free experience.

title: Bethesda hired a Skyrim and Fallout 4 modder to work on Starfield
description: Modder Elianora was hired as a "lighting and clutter artist" on Starfield.

title: Starfield player saves his family from a fire after playing the game all night
description: Playing Starfield all night allegedly enabled a fan to save his family from a fire.

title: Starfield player saves their family from a fire after playing the game all night
description: Playing Starfield all night allegedly enabled a fan to save their family from a fire.

title: European phone shipments sink to a new low
description: European consumers aren't that interested in new smartphones, new reports claim.

title: Loki season 2 will reportedly be 2023's final Marvel TV show as multiple Disney Plus projects get pushed back
description: Marvel has shuffled its Disney Plus show pack in a bid to combat the ongoing Hollywood strikes.

title: Final Fantasy 16 PC version on the way, along with two paid DLC packs
description: Final Fantasy 16 shows no signs of slowing down, with a PC version and two DLC packs confirmed by producer Yoshi-P.

title: SAG-AFTRA strike expands to include video games after unanimous vote
description: Prominent US entertainment union SAG-AFTRA has voted to authorize strikes for its members in the video games industry,.

title: Valve has banned 90,000 Dota 2 Smurf accounts
description: Valve says that any main Dota 2 account associated with a Smurf will get deleted.

title: Little Nightmares 3 will only feature online co-op
description: Supermassive Games has confirmed that Little Nightmares 3 will not feature couch co-op.
